item.title: The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1
item.description:
The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1

How a 29-year-old idealist built a global drug bazaar and became a murderous kingpin.

item.title: Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius
item.description:
Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius

Karl Ove Knausgård, a Norwegian now domiciled with his wife and four kids in Sweden, is perhaps the world's most revered living writer. Only, if he were American, the principal thing he and everyone else would say about him is that he is an alcoholic.

item.title: Pricing, Revenue & Demand Trends in New Jersey's Medical Marijuana Market - Marijuana Business Daily
item.description:
Pricing, Revenue & Demand Trends in New Jersey's Medical Marijuana Market - Marijuana Business Daily

By Omar Sacirbey New Jersey's medical cannabis program has shrugged off its sluggish start and is growing rapidly despite having some of the highest prices in the nation. But the state isn't ready to add more business licenses anytime soon, and at least one dispensary said demand isn't quite yet at the levels it expected.

item.title: Everyday Britain, through the eyes of international photographers
item.description:
Everyday Britain, through the eyes of international photographers

Strange and Familiar is a Martin Parr-curated exhibit showcasing the best of British by those who have decided to make it home. Upending British clichés and finding gold among the stuff we often consider banal, Strange and Familiar is a Martin Parr-curated exhibit showcasing the best of British by those who have decided to make it home.

item.title: House of Commons: Legalisation of Cannabis in the UK (March 2016)
item.description:
House of Commons: Legalisation of Cannabis in the UK (March 2016)

Norman Lamb puts forward the case for de-criminalisting Cannabis in the House of Commons shortly after it makes it into official Liberal Democrat Party policy at their 2016 Spring Conference. What does everybody think? Progressive move forward or dangerous step into the unknown? Recorded from BBC Parliament, 23 March 2016.

item.title: Andy Shauf - The Magician by antirecords
item.description:

item.title: FDA Orders New Warnings For Opioid Pain Drug Labels; Whether They'll Have Much Effect Isn't Clear
item.description:
FDA Orders New Warnings For Opioid Pain Drug Labels; Whether They'll Have Much Effect Isn't Clear

Whether new black box warnings on opioid pain medication labels will reduce inappropriate prescribing isn't clear. Research suggests such warnings, the strongest type there is on drug labels, have mixed results.

item.title: KING: Why the 'War on Drugs' is really a war on black people
item.description:
KING: Why the 'War on Drugs' is really a war on black people

Last week I spoke at Dillard University, a historically black college in New Orleans. About 400 students crowded into the auditorium. At one point, I asked students to raise their hand if they had a friend or family member currently in jail or prison. Nearly every hand was raised.

item.title: Luton drug dealer who was caught with large amount of LSD-type drugs at music festival jailed
item.description:
Luton drug dealer who was caught with large amount of LSD-type drugs at music festival jailed

A drug dealer who was caught with £1,400 worth of an LSD-type substance at a Northamptonshire music festival has been sentenced to three years in jail. Lewis Brown, aged 21, of Summerfield Road, Luton, was stopped by security as he tried to enter the Illusive music event in Deene Park, Northamptonshire, on September 11 last year.
